contentrichtext.text: In [[Cook Islands mythology]] (Aitutaki), '''Nganaoa''' is a hero in the story of Rata's canoe who killed three sea-monsters: a gigantic [[clam]], a huge [[octopus]], a finally a great [[whale]] in the stomach of which he found his father, [[Tairitokerau]], and his mother VÄiaroa alive (Gill 1876:147). ==References== *W.W. Gill, ''Myths and Songs of the South Pacific'' (Henry S. King: London), 1876. [[Category:Cook Islands mythology]] [[Category:Heroes in mythology and legend]] {{Oceania-myth-stub}} {{CookIslands-stub}}
